website_summaries.verdict: This built-in product surpasses them all in convenience and ease of use.
pros: Covers hide the ladder inside the wall and can be painted
Works when windows won't hold other ladders
Is always in place and ready to deploy
No need to search for the ladder in an emergency
cons: The covers on these products sometimes have problems with damage in shipping

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Install was really easy. It recesses in the wall and fits between two standard studs. You remove the drywall, remove the insulation, screw it in and that's about it. It's very well made and has a cover over it so when not in use, you don't even know it's there. My 4 year old can now climb down this from the second floor all by herself so I can sleep much better at night. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon-aholic

customer_reviews.title: The best of both worlds: Safety and Beauty.
customer_reviews.text: Other products were "one time use" only. That didn't sit well with me. This worked as advertised. Ready in a pinch and tested by my son and myself. Turned into a weekend project because of the stud removal but I'm very pleased with the final install and the peace-of-mind that comes with fire escape. Great great product!
customer_reviews.author: Draw

customer_reviews.title: Fairly easy to install, works great for my household
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to install if you have basic carpentry skills. Came with good directions and a helpful template to tape to the wall. I decided on this product as opposed to a hook and ladder setup. Wasn’t sure if my 8 year old could get the hook and ladder setup from under her bed, hook it, open window, and climb down (especially if light/electricity is out). This product takes a couple crucial steps out of the process and during our fire drill, my 8 year old daughter could easily get out of the house. I would recommend this product to households with young children, even though it is more expensive than the hook and ladder style.
customer_reviews.author: Cozanostra

customer_reviews.title: well engineered and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Put this unit into the floor to provide an escape route through my attic down into the garage. Hardware is solid and installation instructions (for a wall install below a window) were very good so it was easy to build a frame using 2x4s in the floor between joists to mount this unit. Climbed down the ladder once (all family members) and I can say that if we ever need it that it will work for everyone. I sleep better at night now :)
customer_reviews.author: Joseph E. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking ladder
customer_reviews.text: Takes some work to install. The framer was off on the studs by about 1/2 an inch so I had to use a chisel to make a little more space between the studs. Apart from that it was a fairly straight-forward installation. It blends in well with the wall when the lid is closed. I like having it always available right where I installed it. Only suggestion would be for them to coat the stand-off legs in plastic so the metal doesn't mar the side of your house when you test it out. I bought some liquid plastic to do it myself over the coming weekend.
customer_reviews.author: R. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: This fire escape is an absolute must for an upstairs bedroom
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the better units on the market. Installation was easy 'cause i had my son-in-law install it. He did a great job and it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Calan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install!  Great safety feature for any house!
customer_reviews.text: This ladder was easy to install and easy to use. I feel that it is more readily accessible to the kids than the ladder that they would have to take out of the box and install themselves should (Heaven forbid) the need arise.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Anyone with 2nd or 3rd floors you need this.
customer_reviews.text: Well made great brand. Not the easiest to navigate if icy or raining out, these would be a challenge but a must have for fire disaster situations.
customer_reviews.author: MSMisBS

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind!
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install (even after I cut the hole for the 3 story instead of 2 story), it looks great, and I love that we have the peace of mind. Don't forget....cut the hole for 2 story, or 3 story. If you have a 2 story home the ladder is smaller than for a 3 story. Makes sense, but seriously, if you are a visual person and don't read the instructions you will make this mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Aaryn

customer_reviews.title: Seems well built
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this with reservations after reading some of the reviews. Mine seemed to be white and not off white, it seems well built and I think I would trust it if needed in an emergency. The only gripe is the lid is slightly cockeyed but I think I can adjust the hooks that hold it in place. WIll update once installed.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall

customer_reviews.title: Now a second way out
customer_reviews.text: Glad I got this.Installed in my daughters attic that's converted into a master bedroom.Placed under a Newley installed large slider window.praticed how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Johnyboy

customer_reviews.title: Great idea and well built
customer_reviews.text: Great idea and well built. Installation can be difficult only because of the studs in your wall. You may need to open up the wall and move a stud or two to properly center this under the window
customer_reviews.author: carlo fricchione

customer_reviews.title: Fire Safety must!
customer_reviews.text: We got two of these for the second floor of our home, and they fit the bill perfectly! They were fairly easy to install. Not serious headaches as we put them in. The white is true white and matches the walls perfectly. They recess into the wall nicely and don't stick out to hit your shins on. They are easy to open and throw out the window. The kids seem to be able to use them without much effort. This is a great upgrade to the old metal ladders that used to be in the third floor of my house as a kid!
customer_reviews.author: Elle Emme

customer_reviews.title: easy to install, great looking finish
customer_reviews.text: You may get lucky and have your cripple spacing lined up with the center of the window, otherwise a little more work to install but overall it looks great flush mounted and best of all,...it doesn't end up in a closet where it does no good in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Dominion Decks

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 for a second story addition I'm doing and So far so good. Install was easy. Directions are easy to understand. Lets just hope I don't have to use these darn things.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: It is worth every cent!
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to the safety of my children, I won't cheat them! When we added our two story addition the kids rooms were going to be upstairs. We installed one in each bedroom. And had a practice drill to ensure they knew how to use it. Don't Cheat safety, cause you'll pay later.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: That this product will work when you need it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for peace of mind and security

customer_reviews.text: It wasn't too hard to install and looks great in the room (blends well with the wall). I do like that it is reusable.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Well made product that I hope to never have to use, however I have the peace of mind that it there to protect me and my family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed. Five stars would be appropriate if it weren't for the misleading images that made it seem to stick out from the wall about 3/4 inch but is more like 1 1/4 inches as there is the cover which fits flush to the metal insert that itself extends 3/4 inches from the wall. I thought the cover would fit over the metal insert to at least give the impression that an effort was made to streamline the look. It is pure function but in case of a fire that is what you need. that said, I have since forgotten all about my irritation and have moved on to other issues.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Everything was excellent- On time delivery at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis.White

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: installed 2 of these on my third floor. was easy to install and I like it that they are reusable and the stairs hide in a box mounted on a wall -- very nice. I would have liked for these to come with a sticker saying something like "Emergency Ladder" or something like that. Also climbing down is a little bit of a workout because of the straps connecting the steps, but as long as I can get out in an emergency, doesn't really matter...
customer_reviews.author: EZ

customer_reviews.title: Nice ladder, some carpentry skills may be necessary
customer_reviews.text: I did cut this Ladder into the wall successfully. Unfortunately, I have a rather unusual setup. Therefore, some wall mudding and wall texturing, as well as painting was necessary. But, this ladder, although untested at this point, appears to be sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis D. Ranck

customer_reviews.title: What a deal, most durable, stable, and it even looks good in the wall.
customer_reviews.text: Had to fiddle with non standard framing, better built than I expected, price was worth every nickel, passed the stood onit test,
customer_reviews.author: itRAINSinOregon

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This product is almost impossible to use -- it would take someone with a high level of agility and athletic ability to use this to escape. Our 35 year-old son, who is slender, flexible and in great shape, tried it, and he could not get out of the window and onto the ladder. Save your money and try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Acosta-Cruz

customer_reviews.title: werner fire escape ladders 2 story
customer_reviews.text: after seeing my parents house catch fire & burned down. i realize just how important every seconds count! i have 2 small children ,so i purchased one for each room. very easy to install!! my children & i practice fire drills once a month. the good thing about this product is its under the window because trust me every seconds counts!!!! you dont want to spend time looking for a ladder when the house is on fire!! great product!!
customer_reviews.author: happy in va.

product_meta.title: Werner ESC220 Fire Escape Ladder, Two Story
product_meta.description:
Size Name:Two StoryDuring a fire, every second counts. That's why the Werner ESC-220 Two-Story Fire Escape Ladder is made to help you and your family evacuate your home quickly. Designed for placement on your home's second story, this durable ladder installs in the wall below a window, so it's always ready to go and can never be misplaced. When Every Second Counts According to the U. S. Fire Administration, a small flame can grow out of control in 30 seconds, turning into a major fire that threatens serious injury or death. Moreover, most residential fires occur at night while we sleep, and they spread too quickly for the fire department to respond. For the best chance of survival, families need to be able to escape from an upstairs window within 30 seconds. The ESC-220 makes that possible. Permanently Installs for Peace of Mind In the event of an emergency, you need to secure your family, not your fire ladder. That's why the ESC-220 permanently installs into the wall below a second-story window. This clever design means you'll never spend wasted time trying to locate your emergency ladder. An added bonus, the ESC-220 blends with any décor, as it can be painted or wallpapered to complement your room. User-Friendly Design is Strong and Heat Resistant Because you have only seconds to exit a burning home, the ESC-220 is easy to deploy--it fully extends to 17 feet, 2 inches when the release tab is pulled. This escape ladder is also incredibly strong and sturdy, with heat-resistant nylon webbing and anti-slip flat rungs and stand-offs. To help keep you steady, a helpful first-step assistance strap provides safety and stability. What's more, the ESC-220 holds up to 1, 200 pounds, which allows multiple family members and rescue professionals to use the ladder at the same time. And unlike one-time-use fire ladders, the ESC-220 can be repacked and used for practice drills. About Werner: The Pros' Choice Werner is a manufacturer and distributor of professional fiberglass, aluminum, and wood climbing equipment. With its beginnings as a floor covering and molding business, Werner has evolved over the past 60 years into a climbing equipment leader. Today, Werner ladders are found on more trucks and jobsites than all other ladder brands combined.
